name: drying of bread grain, seed and legumes | drying of bread grain, seed and legumes | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/2693/documentation

The functional unit is kg water evaporated. This module should be used when evaluating drying of bread grains, seed and legumes.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



The inventory takes into account the energy demand (supplied by burning light fuel oil and consumption of electricity) for evaporating 1 kg of water, when drying grain at low temperature (80-90°C). Also included in the inventory is the infrastructure (building and machinery). Inventoried outputs are heat waste and air emissions from combustion. Not included are waste and other air emissions (like dust). Production of the wet educt and utilisation of the dried product, are not included.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0163:Post-harvest crop activities

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time of publication in literature and annual reports. Most publications between 2001 and 2002.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventories are based on indications made by drying plants in Switzerland and values given in international references (Western Europe).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The inventories are based on common grain drying plants.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Values are based partially on non verified measurements, on expert estimations and on international references. This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography CH. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.

exchanges.description:
Estimation. A typical grain-drying plant consists of the dryer itself, built on a surface area of 150 square meters (about 12 m * 12 m), and up to four storeys in height (Häusermann 2002). Most plants do not have a storehouse. As with the drying plants for grass and maize, this surface is included as "building, hall", with a lifetime of 50 years as well. The total surface area of a plant, including building surface and surroundings, was also estimated to be 3000 square meters (Häusermann 2002). The total surface area of a plant was also included for the building and dismantling phases as "occupation, construction site". The area of the building, and of the land transformation, calculated for one kilogram evaporated water, is obtained by dividing the total surface area of the building or of the environs by the annual yield of dried product, the water evaporated per kilogram of dried product and by the lifetime of the infrastructure.

The capacity utilization rate is 4/12 (4 months per year)
EcoSpold01Location=CH
